main.description:
Boracay is the Philippines’ crown jewel, celebrated globally for its powdery white sands and azure waters. This world-renowned island is a beacon for both relaxation and adventure, offering a harmonious mix of laid-back tropical charm and vibrant nightlife. Recognized as one of the best island destinations in the world, it continues to elevate the country’s tourism profile.

At the heart of this paradise lies Discovery Boracay, a trailblazer in luxury and Filipino hospitality. Known for its award-winning service, the resort redefines indulgence with bespoke guest experiences and eco-friendly practices. Discovery Boracay not only creates memorable stays but also champions initiatives that protect Boracay’s natural splendor for generations to come.

main.description:
Coron, Palawan, is nature at its most breathtaking. Famous for its crystal-clear lagoons, hidden beaches, and world-class dive sites, Coron is a sanctuary for travelers seeking untouched beauty and adventure. Its unparalleled marine biodiversity and iconic limestone cliffs have solidified its position as a top destination for eco-tourism.

Discovery Coron embraces the essence of this natural paradise. Combining understated luxury with sustainability, it offers guests a chance to explore Palawan responsibly. By incorporating community-driven initiatives and conservation efforts, the resort ensures that Coron’s pristine beauty remains preserved while providing an immersive and enriching experience.

main.description:
Samal Island in Davao del Norte offers a serene escape from the fast-paced world. Known for its pristine beaches, lush greenery, and vibrant marine life, it has become a go-to destination for both leisure and business travelers. Its status as a premier eco-tourism spot and proximity to Davao City make it an accessible yet unspoiled gem.

Discovery Samal is setting a new benchmark in Mindanao’s hospitality scene. Boasting the largest convention center in the region, it combines luxury with purpose, catering to both corporate events and tranquil getaways. With a commitment to sustainability and community engagement, the resort perfectly encapsulates the spirit of Samal Island.

main.description:
Makati Central Business District, the financial heartbeat of the Philippines, exudes an energy unlike any other. As a hub for business and culture, it attracts cosmopolitan travelers drawn to its thriving corporate sector, upscale shopping, and buzzing nightlife. A city that never sleeps, Makati serves as a center for innovation and sophistication in Metro Manila.

Discovery Primea is an icon of elegance in the heart of Makati. Renowned for its thoughtful design and impeccable service, it caters to business professionals, travelers, and urban explorers. With luxurious accommodations and curated experiences, Discovery Primea sets the gold standard for hospitality in the city’s vibrant landscape.

main.description:
Ortigas Center is one of Metro Manila’s most established business and lifestyle districts, sitting at the crossroads of Pasig, Mandaluyong, and Quezon City. It’s known for its impressive skyline, corporate offices, shopping malls, and lively dining and entertainment spots. Popular destinations like SM Megamall, The Podium, and Estancia Mall make it a favorite for both locals and travelers looking to explore the city.

Right in the heart of Ortigas is Discovery Suites, a well-loved choice for travelers seeking spacious, fully serviced suites with modern comforts and city views. Perfect for long stays, business trips, or family weekends, the hotel offers thoughtful amenities including an indoor pool, fitness center, and its signature restaurant, Prime 22.

main.description:
Sipalay, often called the "Jewel of the Sugar Island," is a retreat into the untouched beauty of Negros Occidental. This tranquil destination is known for its secluded beaches, marine sanctuaries, and lush landscapes. Offering respite from the fast-paced world, Sipalay is a haven for eco-conscious travelers.

Manami Resort, part of Discovery Hospitality's Signature Collection, captures the essence of Sipalay. Designed to harmonize with its idyllic setting, the resort offers curated experiences, personalized service, and sustainable practices. Manami Resort redefines luxury, giving guests an unparalleled opportunity to connect with nature.

main.description:
El Nido, Palawan, is a living postcard of limestone cliffs, crystal-clear waters, and vibrant marine ecosystems. A favorite among global travelers, this stunning destination is synonymous with island-hopping adventures and jaw-dropping scenery. Its natural allure makes it a cornerstone of Philippine tourism.

Soon to open in El Nido, Kip&Kin is designed for Millennials and Gen Z, combining the best of a hotel and hostel experience. Kip&Kin merges modern comfort with eco-conscious values, creating a space where guests can connect, unwind, and explore responsibly.

main.description:
Siargao, known as the "Surfing Capital of the Philippines," draws travelers from across the globe with its world-class waves and laid-back vibe. Beyond surfing, Siargao’s hidden lagoons, mangrove forests, and vibrant culture make it a multi-faceted destination for adventure and relaxation.

Kip&Kin Siargao mirrors the island’s unique charm, offering eco-friendly accommodations and local experiences that celebrate its essence. Focused on community empowerment, the property provides a balance of comfort and purpose, inviting guests to live the island life in its truest form.

main.description:
San Vicente, Palawan, is a rising star in eco-tourism, home to the country’s longest white sand beach spanning 14 kilometers. This quiet haven provides an alternative to more crowded destinations, offering untouched natural beauty and unmatched tranquility. San Vicente plays a vital role in the push for sustainable tourism in Palawan.

With Kip&Kin and a Discovery Resort in the pipeline, Discovery Hospitality’s presence in San Vicente epitomizes responsible tourism. With properties designed to harmonize with nature, it fosters community involvement and environmental preservation. San Vicente becomes more than a destination—it’s a symbol of how tourism can thrive alongside conservation.
